title: Tesla Disbands Dojo Supercomputer Team
description: In a blow to Tesla’s efforts in artificial intelligence, the company has decided to disband its Dojo supercomputer team. Bloomberg’s Max Chafkin discusses what’s behind the move and how the company will pivot with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nuclear power in a ‘renaissance,’ AtkinsRéalis CEO says
description: The head of AtkinsRéalis says the Canadian engineering giant is taking advantage of a global shift towards nuclear power, which he believes is key to fulfilling the growing energy needs of artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure.
content:
Ian Edwards, CEO, AtkinsRéalis, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss the company's Q2 earnings and nuclear expansion opportunity.

title: DeepSeek Vs OpenAI | Microsoft And Openai Probe Unauthorized Data Access Linked To Deepseek Ai |N18G
description: Microsoft Corp. and OpenAI are investigating whether data output from OpenAI’s technology was obtained in an unauthorized manner by a group linked to Chinese artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek, according to people familiar with the matter.Microsoft’s security researchers in the fall observed individuals they believe may be linked to DeepSeek exfiltrating a large amount of data using the OpenAI application programming interface, or API, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the matter is confidential. Software developers can pay for a license to use the API to integrate OpenAI’s proprietary artificial intelligence models into their own applications. News18 Mobile App - https://onelink.to/desc-youtube
content:
Last Updated: January 29, 2025, 21:13 IST Tech

title: WATCH: How to buy plane tickets in the AI era
description: Delta is using artificial intelligence to help set some airfare prices. That has sparked fears that the airline, or any airline in the future, could create a custom price for you, using your data to find how much you would be willing to pay for a ticket.

title: War and peace: New arms race?
description: MILITARY weapons, and equipment magazines and exhibition brochures summarize trends in preparation for a defensive war as follows: maximizing the military potential of artificial intelligence and the move toward weapons with multi-mission capabilities; advances in robotic and autonomous systems from solely explosive ordnance disposal to wider capabilities such as chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear and explosive detection; unmanned aerial vehicles, unmanned amphibious systems to more flexible counter unmanned systems and how humans can interact with unmanned vehicles.

title: Digital literacy, intersectoral action key to successful fraud prevention in PH
description: WHAT began as simple phishing emails has evolved into a complex network of online schemes that leave many pockets dry. Powered by both cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI) deepfakes and forged IDs, digital fraud is more challenging to battle against despite financial technology’s undeniable convenience.

title: TDCX Group launches Chemin to help enterprises navigate complexity, unlock full potential of AI
description: TDCX Group has launched Chemin, an artificial intelligence (AI) enablement company that helps businesses adopt and scale AI with clarity and confidence. Chemin, which means “path” in French, was established to address common challenges in AI implementation such as fragmented data, poor integration and lack of expertise.

title: Meta picks Pimco, Blue Owl for $29 billion data center deal
description: Meta Platforms Inc. has selected Pacific Investment Management Co. and Blue Owl Capital Inc. to lead a $29 billion financing for its data center expansion in rural Louisiana as the race for artificial intelligence infrastructure heats up, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
